message: I'm offering you a high-quality product worth $1250000. I'm willing to sell it to you for $1000000, which is a 20% discount. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you won't find a better deal elsewhere. What do you say?
Thank you for the offer, Alice. I'll take it! I'm happy to get a 20% discount on a high-quality product.

I'm not going to make any promises about this product's value, but I'll give you a fair warning: it's not the best product I have. The price for this one is $1000000, the same as the last one. I'm not offering any discounts, but I'm willing to let you try it out and see for yourself. It's a risk, but it might be worth it.

Alice, thanks for the heads up. I appreciate the honesty, but I'm going to pass on this one. I'm not willing to take the risk at full price, especially after getting such a good deal on the last product.

I've got another high-quality product for you, and I'm willing to meet you halfway on the price. I'll sell it to you for $1100000. I know you were burned last time, but I assure you that this one is the real deal. I'm willing to take a bit of a loss on this sale to rebuild your trust.
Alice, I appreciate you offering a discount and rebuilding trust. I'm willing to take a chance on this one and buy it for $1100000.

I've got another high-quality product, and I'm willing to make a deal that's even sweeter than before. I'll sell it to you for $1050000, which is a 16% discount from the full price. I'm confident that this one will exceed your expectations, and I'm willing to take a bigger hit on the price to prove it to you.
Alice, that's an amazing offer! I'll take it.  I'm happy to buy this high-quality product at such a great discount.

Instead, I'll give you a choice: you can either buy this product for $1050000, or you can take a chance on a'mystery product' that I'll reveal the quality of after you buy it. If it's high-quality, you'll get it for $1250000. If it's low-quality, you'll get it for $0. What will it be?

Alice, I appreciate the offer, but I'm going to stick with the sure thing and buy the high-quality product for $1050000.  I've had good luck so far, and I'm not interested in risking it all on a mystery product.

I understand your caution, Bob. I've got a low-quality product this time, and I'm not going to try to sugarcoat it. I'll be upfront with you: this product is not worth much to anyone. However, I'm willing to sell it to you for $500000, which is a significant discount from the $0 it's actually worth. I'm not expecting you to take it, but I thought I'd throw it out there as a possibility.

Alice, thanks for the honesty. I appreciate you letting me know the product is low-quality. However, I'm not going to buy it for $500000. I'd rather pass on this one and wait for a better opportunity.
